{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kartagener syndrome is characterized by situs inversus totalis, bronchiectasis, and sinusitis. It is a genetic disorder that affects the structure and function of cilia. Cilia are important for the movement of sperm in the male reproductive system. Therefore, the infertility in Kartagener syndrome is most likely due to the blockage of the epididymis, which is the structure that stores and transports sperm.", "answer_choice": "B"}
